column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^Alleluia: Praise the Lord
column3: for he is good
column4: for his mercy is for ever.

column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^Praise ye the God of gods
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^Praise ye the Lord of lords
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^Who alone doth great wonders
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^Who made the heavens in understanding
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^Who established the earth above the waters
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^Who made the great lights
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^The sun to rule the day
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column1: Lūnam et stēllās in potestātem noctis
column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^The moon and the stars to rule the night
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column1: Quī percussit Aegiptum cum prīmōgenitīs eōrum
column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^Who smote Egypt with their firstborn
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column1: Quī ēdūxit Isrāēl dē mediō eōrum
column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^Who brought out Israel from among them
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column2: et bracchiō excelsō
column3: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^With a mighty hand and with a stretched out arm
column4: for his mercy is for ever.

column1: Quī dīvīsit Mare Rubrum in dīvīSionēs
column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^Who divided the Red Sea into parts
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column1: Et ēdūxit Isrāēl per medium ejus
column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^And brought out Israel through the midst thereof
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column2: et virtūtem ejus in Marī Rubrō
column3: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^And overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the Red Sea
column4: for his mercy is for ever.

column1: Quī trādūxit populum suum per dēsertum
column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^Who led his people through the desert
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^Who smote great kings
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^And slew strong kings
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^Sehon king of the Amorrhites
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^And Og king of Basan
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^And he gave their land for an inheritance
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^For an inheritance to his servant Israel
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column1: Quia in humilitāte nostrā memor fuit nostrī
column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^For he was mindful of us in our affliction
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column1: Et redēmit nōs ab inimīcīs nostrīs
column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^And he redeemed us from our enemies
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^Who giveth food to all flesh
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^Give glory to the God of heaven
column3: for his mercy is for ever.

column2: quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus.^Give glory to the Lord of lords
column3: for his mercy is for ever.
